name: MSCRMCheckSolution
description: Uses PowerApps Checker API to validate your solution against a list of known issues
author: Wael Hamze

inputs.name: solutionFile
inputs.label: Solution(s) File
inputs.helpMarkDown: The absolute path to the CRM solution(s) zip file on the agent machine

inputs.name: resultsVariableName
inputs.label: Results Variable Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the pipeline variable to be populated with the path to the checker results file

inputs.name: tenantId
inputs.label: Tenant Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: The azure tenant id. Must have at least one instance

inputs.name: applicationId
inputs.label: Application Id
inputs.helpMarkDown: The id of a valid azure active directory app registration. No permissions required.

inputs.name: applicationSecret
inputs.label: Application Secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: The application secret used for connection.

inputs.name: ruleset
inputs.label: Ruleset
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ruleset to use for checking the solution

inputs.name: ruleCodes
inputs.label: Rule Codes (json array)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The rules to use for checking. FORMAT e.g.: ['il-specify-column','meta-remove-inactive']

inputs.name: excludedFiles
inputs.label: Excluded File/Patterns (json array)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The files or patterns to be excluded. FORMAT e.g.: ['form.js','*plugins*']

inputs.name: ruleLevelOverrides
inputs.label: Rule Level Overrides (json array)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this to treat violations of a rule as a higher or lower severity level. FORMAT e.g.: [['meta-avoid-silverlight','High'],['il-specify-column','Low']]

inputs.name: geography
inputs.label: geography
inputs.helpMarkDown: The region where the scan will be executed

OutputVariables.name: SOLUTION_CHECK_RESULT_FILE
OutputVariables.description: The absolute path to solution check result file on the agent server
